NAME.Nominative: Blessed Maximus of Totma, the Fool-for-Christ († 1650)

LIFE.Copyright: Bulgakov Handbook. Copyright 1997 by translator Fr. S. Janos.

SAINT.LIFE: Blessed Maximus, Priest of Totma, was for a certain time priest in the city of Tot′ma in Vologda diocese. Over the course of forty years he made the harsh exploit of fool-for-Christ, constantly in fasting and in prayer. Blessed Maxim died in extreme old age on 16 January 1650 and was buried at the Resurrection church, in which he served. The local veneration of the saint began in 1715, in connection with numerous miracles occurring at his grave.
